main.message: Hi {{userName}}, what would you like to explore?

SII PROGRAMME.message: Here are some options about the Study in India Programme:

About Study in India Programme.message: The Study In India (SII) programme is a flagship project of the Government of India executed by the Ministry of Education (MoE), Government of India. The programme has been put together to facilitate and encourage international students to study in India’s premier Indian institutes. The Study in India website will be the one stop solution for all information about the studying in India.

Benefits of SII Programme.message:
The Study in India Programme offers international students a chance to study at top Indian institutions. It includes 600+ partner institutes offering 8000+ courses in Engineering, Law, Management, Humanities, Yoga, and more.

Eligible institutes are NAAC ≥ 3.01, NIRF ranked, INIs/IOEs, listed in QS Asia Rankings, or have UGC/AICTE autonomous status. Scholarships or fee waivers (10%–100%) are available based on merit and institute discretion.

3 Pillars of SII Programme.message:
The Study in India Programme is built on three pillars:

**Learn** – Access top institutions offering affordable, quality education with a focus on both theory and practical skills.

**Thrive** – Join a global, multicultural environment that fosters growth and innovation—alumni work at top firms like Microsoft and Google.

**Explore** – Experience India’s rich culture, heritage sites, festivals, and diverse lifestyle alongside your studies.

List of Institutes & Courses.message: The list of the institutes and courses offered under the Study in India programme can be found by clicking on the ‘Courses’ page present on the top of the homepage of the SII website.

How to Apply to SII.message:
Applying to the Study in India programme is simple. Just follow these key steps:
1. **Register** – Sign up on the SII website.
2. **Plan** – Estimate your budget.
3. **Apply** – Choose your preferred course and institute.
4. **Check Result** – View your allotted course and institute.
5. **Prepare** – Get ready for your educational journey to India.

Available Courses.message: The Institutions within the ‘Study in India’ offer a range of courses across various disciplines. It has over 2600 courses ranging from popular courses like Engineering & Technology, Agriculture, Law, Arts & Humanities, Paramedical & Allied Health courses, Languages, niche courses such as Yoga, Buddhist Studies, etc

Contact Project Officers.message: Yes, the website, https://studyinindia.gov.in/, is the backbone of the Study in India operations and what it offers to international students. You can get all information needed from the officers of Study in India through a Toll-Free Number (+91120-6565065) and email at studyinindia@aicte-india.org. (support@studyinIndia.gov.in) You may also find large information in social media pages – Facebook, twitters, blogs as well

How many courses and Institutes are cove.message: India has the world’s second-largest higher education network, with more than 42,000 colleges and 1000 universities. SII has partnered with 600+ top-ranked institutes, offering 8000+ courses across a range of disciplines.
options: Can I change my allotted institute

What are STEM and non-STEM courses

Can I change my allotted institute.message: Once an institute has been allotted, it cannot be changed. But if the institute permits, the allotted course can be changed.
options: How many courses and Institutes are covered under Study in India
What type of degrees are provided under niche courses
Can I apply for courses of study in Medicine and its related areas with the Program
What are STEM and non-STEM courses

What type of degrees are provided under.message: All the degrees courses offered are Regular & full-time with the prescribed duration as specified for each level. The courses are structured by educational institutes duly recognized by the statutory and regulatory body of the Government of India, which also follows the global practices and accolades as prescribed therein.
options: How many courses and Institutes are covered under Study in India
Can I change my allotted institute
Can I apply for courses of study in Medicine and its related areas with the Program
What are STEM and non-STEM courses

Can I apply for courses of study in Medi.message: Students cannot apply for Undergraduate in Medicine and their related programs. There are no medical courses under the Study in India. However, students can pursue Para-Medical & allied areas courses, such as Pharmacy, Nursing, Medical Laboratory Technology, Physiotherapy etc.
options: How many courses and Institutes are covered under Study in India
Can I change my allotted institute
What type of degrees are provided under niche courses
What are STEM and non-STEM courses

What are STEM and non-STEM courses.message:
STEM Courses focus on Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics with a hands-on, interdisciplinary approach to real-world problem-solving.

Non-STEM Courses include Commerce, Arts, Business, Humanities, and Social Sciences. These programs build strong skills in communication, critical thinking, and creativity—offering career paths in education, marketing, journalism, and more.

REGISTRATION AND CHOICE FILLING.message: Here’s everything you need to know about registration and filling your choices:
options: What information do I need to fill application
How many preferences of institutes can I choose
I am having trouble with grade conversion

What information do I need to fill appli.message:
You need to fill in different information across the three sections of the application and the sections include:

• Basic Information - In this section, you are required to provide basic information, parents' details, addresses, and passport details.
• Academic Information - In this section, you are required to provide academic details, information about additional exams (like GRE, GMAT, SAT, JEE Advanced & Mains, TOEFL, IELTS, etc.), and upload your documents for verification.
• Choice Filling - You can fill in your choice of courses and institutes once the ‘choice filling’ opens.
options: How many preferences of institutes can I choose
I am having trouble with grade conversion
Back to REGISTRATION AND CHOICE FILLING

How many preferences of institutes can I.message: You have to fill in a minimum of 3 institute preferences during choice filling and there is no upper limit on the preference you give, however you can only accept one offer letter at a time. Please rank your choices carefully as the final allocation of the institute (during counselling) is done on the basis of the preferences set by you.

I am having trouble with grade conversion
Back to REGISTRATION AND CHOICE FILLING

I am having trouble with grade conversio.message:
If the grades/GPA in your mark sheets is not as per the Indian education system, then refer to this link: https://studyinindia.gov.in/GradesConversion to check the conversions.

If you need further help, you can get in touch with us on our Toll-Free Number: +91120-6565065 or email us at help.studyinindia.gov.in.

COSTS AND FEES.message: Here’s what to expect regarding costs and fees:
options: What is annual average living cost of international student in india
What is annual tuition fee for courses in india
Can my institution provide with additional concessions?

What is annual average living cost of in.message:
The average living cost for an international student in India, per month, amounts to approximately $400. This cost excludes the tuition fee.

A general breakup of monthly expenses is indicated below:

Particulars              Indicative Monthly Expenses
Accommodation            $150
Food & Housekeeping      $100
Mobile Expenses          $10
Personal Expenses        $50
Laundry                  $15
Stationary               $30
Transport                $45

** Please note, the costs may vary from city to city.
options: What is annual tuition fee for courses in india
Can my institution provide with additional concessions?

What is annual tuition fee for courses i.message: The tuition fees vary across courses and institutes. You may find the details of the same through the Courses page present on the homepage.
options: What is annual average living cost of international student in india
Can my institution provide with additional concessions?

Can my institution provide with addition.message: The decision to provide additional concessions on your fees depends entirely on the institute. You may confirm the same at the time of admission from the institute itself..

GLOBALLY ACCEPTED DEGREES.message: Understand the global value of your degree from Indian institutes:
options: Where can i view the ranking list of SII Partner institutes
Are SII partner institutes partner quality assured
Are degrees from SII partnered institutes recognized in the global market?

Where can i view the ranking list of SII.message: Follow the link to have a look at the NIRF rankings of Indian universities - https://www.nirfindia.org/2021/UniversityRanking.html.
options: Are SII partner institutes partner quality assured
Are degrees from SII partnered institutes recognized in the global market?

Are SII partner institutes partner quali.message:
The added advantage of the Study in India Programme is quality assurance wherein it partners up with institutes that:

• Have National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) accreditation of 3.01 and above
• Are ranked among the top 100 in any category (except medical) by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF)
• Have the status of Institute of National Importance (INI) or Institute of Eminence (IOE)
options: Where can i view the ranking list of SII Partner institutes
Are degrees from SII partnered institutes recognized in the global market?

Are degrees from SII partnered institute.message: Yes, all courses with the SII-partner institutes are recognized globally, not only for higher education but also for employment opportunities.

What is the medium of study at the SII p.message: English is the primary medium of instruction at most SII partner institutes.

What english proficiency tests are popul.message: It varies from institute to institute, but generally, scores of IELTS or TOEFL are considered. However, you are advised to check the specific eligibility criteria set by the SII partner institute while applying.
options: What is the medium of study at the SII partnered institutes
Am i still able to study in india if english is not my first language

Am i still able to study in india if eng.message: If you have secured the required scores in English proficiency tests such as IELTS or TOEFL or scored the required marks in the institute’s English aptitude test then you are eligible to study in India.

VISA REGULATIONS.message: Here’s what you need to know about student visas in India:
options: Where can i apply for indian student visa
What is the average fees for indian student visa
What are the documents required for a indian student visa
Would i get a work visa after graduation
Do i get medical insurance with my student visa

Where can i apply for indian student vis.message:
Students will need to apply for a visa separately on the portal https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/ after they’ve registered on the portal, received their unique student ID, applied and received offer letter from their preferred institution(s).

NOTE: Applying on the StudyinIndia portal does not guarantee a Student Visa and is subject to approval under prevailing laws and regulations in India.
options: What is the average fees for indian student visa
What are the documents required for a indian student visa
Would i get a work visa after graduation
Do i get medical insurance with my student visa

What is the average fees for indian stud.message: The fees for a student visa is different for different countries. Generally, the amount ranges from $14 to $118 but the students are advised to check the fees by contacting the Indian mission/embassy present in their home country
options: Where can i apply for indian student visa
What are the documents required for a indian student visa
Would i get a work visa after graduation
Do i get medical insurance with my student visa

What are the documents required for a in.message:
YDocuments required to process student visa at StudyInIndia portal:

• Passport (with course duration validity)
• Passport size photographs
• Photocopy of passport
• Proof of residential address
• A printed copy of the online (filled) form
• Formal admission letter
• Printed proof of fees paid to the institute
• Details of the University
• Bank statement

DISCLAIMER: However, the requirement of documents for student visas may differ across countries. You are required to confirm the same from the nearest Indian embassy.
options: Where can i apply for indian student visa
What is the average fees for indian student visa
Would i get a work visa after graduation
Do i get medical insurance with my student visa

Would i get a work visa after graduation.message: No, you will not get a work visa in India after graduation
options: Where can i apply for indian student visa
What is the average fees for indian student visa
Do i get medical insurance with my student visa

Do i get medical insurance with my stude.message:
You will not receive medical insurance with an Indian student visa. However, some institutes do provide medical insurance to their international students.

NOTE: It is advised that each international student should get medical insurance.

ADMISSIONS.message: Admissions FAQs for Study in India:
options: What if institute rejects my application would i be given another chance to apply
If it shows "Institute Action is pending", what do I expect in such a case
What information is present on the result that gets published on the student dashboard

What if institute rejects my application.message: The second round of counselling is conducted for the students who do not get the allotment from any institute or got rejected by the institute in the first round. PLEASE NOTE: This depends on whether the next institute in your preference list still accepting students under the respective course.
options: If it shows "Institute Action is pending", what do I expect in such a case
What information is present on the result that gets published on the student dashboard

If it shows \"Institute Action is pendin.message: SII has shared your details with the institutes and Institutes will accept or reject your application after checking the documents uploaded. The status will be updated by the institute only..
options: What if institute rejects my application would i be given another chance to apply
What information is present on the result that gets published on the student dashboard

What information is present on the resul.message: Generally, the result obtained contains essential information such as the Allotted Institute, Discipline, Qualification, Program Level, Specialization, Partner Institute Scholarship, Institute Action Status and VISA status.
options: What if institute rejects my application would i be given another chance to apply
If it shows "Institute Action is pending", what do I expect in such a case

Can NRIs apply for study in india progra.message: NRIs are now eligible to apply for the Study in India programme. However, they will not be eligible for the SII Scholarship.
